Name: Valley Stone Wall: Jade Belt River
Desc: A stone wall with patterned reliefs shaped like waves, so named because the courtyard wall is shaped like a river, and the sculpted reliefs like jade belt buckles. It is said that a reporter from The Steambird once believed that the walls of Chenyu Vale's residences were all made of jade, and published an article titled as such with commentary. This resulted in numerous Fontainian citizens having very unrealistic views of Chenyu Vale.\nThough the ridiculous and irresponsible fabrications were quickly refuted by detailed travelogues, the moniker "city of jade" had become synonymous with Chenyu Vale for many authors, and thus were the seeds of many odd novels sown.\nPerhaps this is what "the sprouting of unintentional consequences" refers to...
